required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Medium-term Health Coaching and Life-long Monitoring in Diabetes Mellitus
clinical_study.official_title: Regions of Europe Working Together for Health (Renewing Health)

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluation whether the introduction of large-scale personalized and technology supported telemonitoring and health coaching interventions produces benefits in terms of health related quality of life, health status and empowerment of patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus. In addition, the trials evaluate the economical and organizational impact of the new services and examine their acceptability by patients and health professionals.

primary_outcome.measure: Health Related Quality of Life as Measured by the Short Form 36 Version 2 Questionnaire
primary_outcome.description: The Short Form (36) Health Survey is a 36-item, patient-reported survey of patient health. The SF-36 is a measure of health status. Mearurement at the beginning and after 12 months, Scales from 0 to 100, higher values represent a better outcome; Data are mean scores (SD); differences between groups after 12 month were compared by using Mann-Whitney-U-tests.
HbA1c was taken at the beginning of the study and after 12 months.

secondary_outcome.description: The number of inpatient stays comparing intervention and control group was conducted.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Self-monitoring for patients with Diabetes mellitus type 2
arm_group.description: Patients are self-monitoring and submitting their vital parameters.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Nurse-monitoring for patients with Diabetes mellitus type 2
arm_group.description: Nurses are measuring and entering the vital parameters of the patients.

intervention.intervention_name: Self-monitoring for patients with Diabetes mellitus type 2
intervention.description: Patients are submitting their vital parameters via a Web Portal or automatic devices to the hospital.
intervention.arm_group_label: Self-monitoring for patients with Diabetes mellitus type 2

intervention.intervention_name: Nurse-monitoring for patients with Diabetes mellitus type 2
intervention.description: Nurses are submitting the vital parameters of the patient via mobile device.
intervention.arm_group_label: Nurse-monitoring for patients with Diabetes mellitus type 2

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- T2DM diagnosed > 3 months prior to the enrollment
- HbA1c >= 6,5 %
- Capability of filling questionnaires by their own language
- Being able to use the devices provided
- Being cognitively able to participate
Exclusion Criteria:

group.title: Control Group
group.description: treatment as usual

group.title: Self-monitoring for Patients With Diabetes Mellitus Type 2
group.description: Patients are self-monitoring and submitting their vital parameters. Self-monitoring for patients with Diabetes mellitus type 2: Patients are submitting their vital parameters via a Web Portal or automatic devices to the hospital.

group.title: Nurse-monitoring for Patients With Diabetes Mellitus Type 2
group.description: nurse-monitoring for patients with Diabetes Mellitus Nurses are entering vital parameters of the patient with mobile devices

participants_list.participants: Due to high age and bad health conditions no patients finished (nursing)

group.title: Control Group
group.description: treatment as usual

group.title: Self-monitoring and Nurse Monitoring Diabetes Mellitus Type 2
group.description: Patients are self-monitoring and submitting their vital parameters. Self-monitoring for patients with Diabetes mellitus type 2: Patients are submitting their vital parameters via a Web Portal or automatic devices to the hospital. Nurses are measuring and entering the vital parameters of the patients. Nurse-monitoring for patients with Diabetes mellitus type 2: Nurses are submitting the vital parameters of the patient via mobile device. No patients using the mobile nursing finished the study, so in the final statistical analysis they were not analysed as separate arm. Due to low enrollement in the Nurse Monitoring arm, it is combined in this module.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Health Related Quality of Life as Measured by the Short Form 36 Version 2 Questionnaire
outcome.description: The Short Form (36) Health Survey is a 36-item, patient-reported survey of patient health. The SF-36 is a measure of health status. Mearurement at the beginning and after 12 months, Scales from 0 to 100, higher values represent a better outcome; Data are mean scores (SD); differences between groups after 12 month were compared by using Mann-Whitney-U-tests.
outcome.population: No patients of the Nurse-Monitoring Group finished the study, as a consequence no SF36 after 12 months were delivered, so a calculation and evaluation for this group could not be conducted.

group.title: Control Group
group.description: treatment as usual

group.title: Self-monitoring and Nurse Monitoring Diabetes Mellitus Type 2
group.description: Patients are self-monitoring and submitting their vital parameters. Self-monitoring for patients with Diabetes mellitus type 2: Patients are submitting their vital parameters via a Web Portal or automatic devices to the hospital. Nurses are measuring and entering the vital parameters of the patients. Nurse-monitoring for patients with Diabetes mellitus type 2: Nurses are submitting the vital parameters of the patient via mobile device. No patients using the mobile nursing finished the study, so in the final statistical analysis they were not analysed as separate arm. Due to low enrollement in the Nurse Monitoring arm, it is combined in this module.

measure.title: Health Related Quality of Life as Measured by the Short Form 36 Version 2 Questionnaire
measure.description: The Short Form (36) Health Survey is a 36-item, patient-reported survey of patient health. The SF-36 is a measure of health status. Mearurement at the beginning and after 12 months, Scales from 0 to 100, higher values represent a better outcome; Data are mean scores (SD); differences between groups after 12 month were compared by using Mann-Whitney-U-tests.
measure.population: No patients of the Nurse-Monitoring Group finished the study, as a consequence no SF36 after 12 months were delivered, so a calculation and evaluation for this group could not be conducted.
measure.units: units on a scale (General health score)

measure.title: Number of Hospitalisations

group.title: Control Group
group.description: treatment as usual

group.title: Self-monitoring and Nurse Monitoring Diabetes Mellitus Type 2
group.description: Patients are self-monitoring and submitting their vital parameters. Self-monitoring for patients with Diabetes mellitus type 2: Patients are submitting their vital parameters via a Web Portal or automatic devices to the hospital. Home nursing is also included. Nurses are measuring and entering the vital parameters of the patients. Nurse-monitoring for patients with Diabetes mellitus type 2: Nurses are submitting the vital parameters of the patient via mobile device. No patients using the mobile nursing finished the study, so in the final statistical analysis they were not analysed as separate arm. Due to low enrollement in the Nurse Monitoring arm, it is combined in this module.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
